greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One third of quartic factorial numbers.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..350
M. D. Schmidt, Generalized j-Factorial Functions, Polynomials, and Applications , J. Int. Seq. 13 (2010), 10.6.7, p 39.
formula: G.f.: 1/Q(0) where Q(k)= 1 - x + 2*(2*k-1)*x - 4*x*(k+1)/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 03 2013
D-finite with recurrence: a(n) +(-4*n+1)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 24 2020
program: (PARI) m=20; v=concat([1], vector(m-1)); for(n=2, m, v[n]=(4*n-1)*v[n-1]); v \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 15 2019
(MAGMA) [n le 1 select 1 else (4*n-1)*Self(n-1): n in [1..20]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 15 2019
(Sage) [4^n*rising_factorial(3/4, n)/3 for n in (1..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 15 2019
(GAP) a:=[1];; for n in [2..20] do a[n]:=(4*n-1)*a[n-1]; od; a; # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 15 2019
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_
